Name: Australian Students'​ Society of Haematology
Overview: The Australian Students'​ Society of Haematology (ASSH) is a professional society for students in Australia interested in blood disorders. ASSH has three main aims:1. To foster interest amongst university students in haematology2. To improve university students'​ understanding of core topics in haematology3. To support and advocate for research in haematologyASSH hopes to achieve these aims by:1. Running a series of high quality seminars designed to strengthen students'​ grasp of fundamental haematological principles; elucidate the pathway to becoming a haematologist; and introduce some of the cutting-edge research currently being conducted in the field of haematology. 2. Organising fundraising events to support research in haematology. ASSH membership is completely free-of-charge. Whether you are a budding haematologist, or simply interested to learn more about minutiae of blood and blood disorders, sign up today to receive the latest updates on all the exciting events that we have lined up for the year: https://forms.gle/3oUDwmQLbXqPJeNy9.

Name: Imagine Education Australia
Overview:
IMAGINE EDUCATION AUSTRALIA
ENGLISH LANGUAGE SCHOOL

INFORMATION SHEET

Imagine Education Australia has built brand new, state-of-the-art facilities within the educational precinct of Southport and offers first-rate educational experiences to students from all over the world. Our school has nine classrooms, a computer lab, library, student common area, reception area, staff room, offices and plenty of free parking. Our campus is close to the Broadwater, Surfers Paradise and is within 30 metres of a major shopping centre.  We are located at one of the most spectacular locations in the world – Australia’s Gold Coast – which boasts world famous beaches and theme parks, unpolluted air, lush green rainforest and 245 days of sunshine per year!  

For international students Imagine Education offers a range of courses including the following:

Early Learners (6 weeks to 6 years)
Young Learners (7 to 12 years)
High School Preparation (13 to 18 years)
General English - Beginner to Advanced levels
IELTS Preparation
English for Academic Purposes
English plus Volunteer
Parent and Child Program
Certificate III in Children’s Services
Diploma in Children’s Services
Advanced Diploma in Children’s Services
Hospitality 
Hairdressing 
** Please note there is no age limit for adult student enrolments

Imagine Education can provide students with pathways into Bond University and 6 High Schools.  Our teaching staff are highly qualified and our class sizes are small (10-18 students per class).

Learning materials are supplied free of charge and we also run a free bus service from Broadbeach to Southport daily.  

Another added benefit for students is free computer and internet access.  This allows students to keep in touch with their family and friends as well as assisting them with their school work.

Imagine Education operates a professional HOMESTAY program for those students wishing to experience the Australian culture.  Our Homestay families are carefully selected and provide a safe and caring environment for students.  Full service Homestay includes 3 meals per day (with a cut lunch on school days) and transportation to and from school.

All our Homestay families must hold a current Blue Card.  A Blue Card means that all people living in the home who are over 18 have undergone a national check through the Government.

We specialize in catering for Educational English Language Study Tour Groups and can customize an itinerary to suit the requirements of any group.  Please discuss your requirements with us so we can tailor make an itinerary especially for your group.

Name: Little Scientists Australia
Location: Suite 501, 105 Pitt Street, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU
Overview: Inquiry-based learning in STEM workshops• Little Scientists workshops empower educators to implement inquiry-based STEM learning in their practice.• Hands-on workshops provide a range of tools and concepts to build educators’ confidence in exploring STEM with children.• Every workshops build on educators’ competence in inquiry-based STEM exploration.• Workshops use everyday recycled materials, easy for services to implement.• Each workshop focuses a different STEM topic and costs $115.• Completing a Little Scientists workshop contributes to maintaining NESA Proficient Teacher Accreditation in NSW.• Education services that demonstrate an ongoing dedication to STEM can become a Little Scientists House.• The program aligns with the Early Years Learning Framework (EYLF) and the National Quality Framework (NQF).Our STEM workshop topics are:* ACOUSTICS Fizzle, crackle, crash, bang; delve into the world of everyday sounds.* AIR Bring fresh air into the room, catch soap bubbles & learn that air is so much more than ‘nothing’.* CHEMICAL REACTIONS Uncover the world of chemical reactions by exploring different substances and make a mess experimenting with carbon dioxide.* COMPUTER SCIENCE Learn the foundations of computational thinking and how to “speak to a computer” by understanding how it works.* ENGINEERING Swinging, running, jumping, falling: Physical forces are all part of the fun and children love to explore their effects.* HUMAN BODY We may look quite different on the outside, but underneath our skin, our organs, muscle* MATHEMATICS Experience the wonder of mathematics hidden in everyday patterns, shapes & structures. Fall in love with shapes and space.* OPTICS Enjoy a day full of lights, colours and optical illusions. Explore the land of mirrors, colourful shadows & nature’s paint palette.* WATER Have you ever met a child who is not fascinated by water? From ice blocks to raindrops, children love to explore water from an early age.

Overview:
As the sole professional body for actuaries in Australia, the Actuaries Institute represents the interests of its members to Government, the business community and the general public. 

Actuaries assess risks through long-term analyses, modelling and scenario planning and provide expert comment on a broad range of business-related problems.

This unrivalled expertise enables the profession to comment on a range of business-related problems  including enterprise risk management, finance and investment, prudential regulation, retirement income policy, general insurance, life insurance and health financing.

The Institute is committed to promoting and maintaining a high standard of actuarial practice and represents and supports its members by:

• educating the next generation of actuaries and ensuring skills and knowledge are constantly developed through continuous professional development;
• establishing and maintaining  strict professional and ethical standards;
• fostering a strong professional network and promoting and advancing knowledge in specialist areas of actuarial science through research and events and seminars; and 
• contributing to public policy through policy submissions, thought-leadership and expert analysis.

Name: French Australian Brisbane School (FABS)
Overview: French Australian Brisbane School Ltd (FABS) is a not-for-profit entity incorporated in 2013 with the purpose to support the establishment of schools in Brisbane taught in both French and English. In 2014, after 3 years of discussions between the Queensland Government, the Agency for French Education Abroad (AEFE), the Embassy of France to Australia and the French Community of Brisbane, a Memorandum of Understanding was established between the State of Queensland (represented by the Department of Education), FABS and the Embassy of France to Australia.In 2015, Tingalpa State School (TSS) introduced a French-Australian bilingual program. The initiative began with one Prep class in 2015 and expanded to include Prep to Year 3 the following year. In 2017, the Tingalpa’s French-Australian bilingual program achieved AEFE accreditation from Prep to Y3. In 2019, the first bilingual cohort of Y6 has been successfully graduated from TSS.Today, Tingalpa's French-Australian bilingual program has reached its maximum capacity with one class per year level (up to Y4).However, it's more than 50 Prep students who have applied to join the program in 2021 and everyday new students are denied access to the bilingual program because of the lack of places available.To support all the families desperately seeking French-Australian bilingual education for their children, FABS has reopened discussions with the Australian authorities on one hand and with the French ones on the other hand. FABS' aim is to find a solution to this issue as soon as possible.

Name: Australia Indonesia Youth Exchange Program (AIYEP)
Overview: AIYEP is a one-of-a-kind, highly successful youth cultural exchange program marking its 38th year in 2019. Eighteen young Indonesians aged 21-25 spend two months (October to December) in Australia annually undertaking work placements, homestays, cultural performances and visits to local schools and communities. Eighteen young Australians undertake a similar program in Indonesia with their Indonesian counterparts from December to February annually.AIYEP aims to provide opportunities for young Indonesians and Australians to gain a deeper understanding of the culture, development and way of life of each other's country. Name: ELTHAM College (Australia)
Overview:
ELTHAM is a school unlike any other. We’re constantly adapting to the changing needs of young people and their world. We support them on a journey of self-discovery to unlock their talents through one of Victoria’s broadest curriculums. Most importantly, our teachers guide each young person to become empowered with the self-confidence and independence to manage all aspects of their future lives. 

We aim for our graduates to step into life after school as pro-active young people equipped with the skills and desire to continue successful learning. And while we’re achieving these serious aims, we’re determined to have fun at the same time! Not only do we make learning exciting and relevant to life, we also create a very different and liberating environment where teachers and students share trust and friendship and work together in mutual respect. 

We’re an independent, coeducational, Early Learning - Year 12 school. We’re also proud to be non-selective - we welcome students of all backgrounds, talents and abilities.

Name: Busy Bees Australia
Overview: There’s really something special about a Busy Bees child and it’s because we do things differently.While Busy Bees Australia, as the name suggests is Australian focused, our early learning services are a part of UK-based, global early childhood education operator Busy Bees.  This enables us to draw upon the best early learning practices from around the world.  Our innovative approach is based on the discovery and exploration of respectful relationships with children. We provide exciting opportunities and challenges for children to play and develop and we nurture individuality, helping each child to move at their own pace, in their own way. It is our absolute mission to deliver high-quality childcare and exciting learning opportunities for every child, giving them the best head start as they prepare for school. At Busy Bees, we’re really proud to be part of a global success story. We achieve this working to the highest standards and by keeping our values at the heart of what we do and who we are.Care:  We nurture children through their critical early years with warmth, respect, and dedication.Quality:  We set and maintain very high standards because that’s what our children and parents deserve.Value: We always provide outstanding value for money.Service: We’re an integral part of parents’ support networks.With all of this being said, the best early learning comes from a professional and dedicated team. Our network of Teaching Practitioners, Educators and our wider support teams are passionate, talented and respectful. The teams we’ve put together build strong, positive relationships and take pride in their work. The team caring for all Busy Bees children are well trained, aligned with best practice, and motivated to do more. That’s how we provide the outstanding quality education and care that every child deserves.If you are looking for a position in early learning, an exciting challenge, or you're looking for a more rewarding career,  why not consider working for Busy Bees Australia? At Busy Bees we have a wide range of opportunities for careers in early learning to both challenge and fulfil your working life.Often people think of early learning services as only offering job vacancies working with children, however; due to the ongoing growth of our organisation we are often looking for support staff,  administrators, finance staff, managers and a whole host of other career skill sets.No matter if you have worked in the early learning environment for many years, or are simply looking to start a new chapter in your career path, we encourage you to get in touch with your local Busy Bees Service to see if we have any vacancies for you to come and join the team. Alternatively, you can also contact our Recruitment team by email (recruit@busybees.edu.au) to discuss current opportunities within the wider Busy Bees Australia team.

Name: Australian Musculo-Skeletal Network (AMSN)
Overview:
The Australian Musculo-Skeletal Network (AMSN) exists to provide quality inter-professional development opportunities for practitioners, researchers and academics engaged in Musculo-Skeletal care.

Our goal is to improve the delivery of health care to the community by providing up-to date and clinically relevant content that connects the research community with Practitioners and Practitioners with each other to improve patient outcomes.

The AMSN's Professional network will help you develop your evidence based practice and connect with your Musculo-Skeletal Colleagues.

Overview: TAFE Directors Australia (TDA) is the national peak body incorporated to represent Australia’s public Technical and Further Education (TAFE) institutes and the TAFE divisions of dual sector universities.There are 28 TAFE institutes across all states and territories, including six dual sector universities. TAFEs are the leading providers of vocational education and training (VET) across Australia and is key in delivery of high quality and contemporary vocational education for the nation’s core skilled occupations. Each TAFE on behalf of its state or territory delivers comprehensive tertiary education, spanning technical and further education, senior schooling and higher education. TAFEs engage with local industry and employers and the community to inform delivery. In meeting the education and training needs of their students, the TAFE network serves the needs of Australian industry, enterprises and communities.Australia’s network of TAFE institutes is the largest and most diverse component of our national tertiary education sector, with over 560 delivery locations and campuses located across central business districts, suburban, regional, rural and remote locations. Many institutes offer further services throughout the Asia-Pacific and other offshore regions.The core business of TDA is supporting our member institutes, leading the advocacy for quality skills in Australia, and managing a range of international education and training projects in co-operation with our institutes.TDA was established by TAFE Directors in 1998.

Name: Forum for European-Australian Science and Technology Cooperation
Location: 14 Balmain Lane, The Australian National University, Canberra, ACT 0200, AU
Overview:
The Forum for European–Australian Science and Technology Cooperation (commonly known as “FEAST”) is an organization established by the Australian Government and the European Union to highlight, promote, and facilitate research collaboration between their respective communities.

The FEAST Secretariat is hosted by The Australian National University on behalf of the research community.

FEAST’s mandate is derived from intergovernmental talks between Australia and the European Union. The 1997 Joint Declaration on Relations between Australia and the European Union formalised the commitment to enhanced co-operation, and the Agenda for Co-operation (2003) specifically identified Australia and Europe’s commitment to making optimal use of FEAST as a key vehicle in promoting, facilitating, and evaluating collaborative research between Australia and Europe.

Overview: ABW is a leading developer of business simulations for schools, tertiary institutions and the corporate sector. Over 150,000 people have participated in our simulations during the past two decades. We offer simulations for students, employees and other individuals who’d like to learn from the hands-on experience of running a virtual business.Our enterprise education programs incorporate computer simulated business environments. In the safety of the virtual world, participants assume management roles in businesses and make decisions (good or bad!) that affect business performance. For schools, the programs replace the regular curriculum for a one-week period, allowing students to immerse themselves in the virtual business world. Because it’s experiential learning, rather than a lecture, it’s invaluable in terms of encouraging team work and a sense of responsibility, exercising decision making skills, and boosting confidence. It’s also an exciting and fun learning experience and a break from the routine of the typical school week.ABW has strong support for programs from the corporate sector. Volunteers from the business community provide mentoring support to participating student teams, with more than 15,000 businesses contributing to programs to date.

WHAT IS A CPA?A Certified Practising Accountant (CPA) is a finance, accounting and business professional with a specific qualification. Being a CPA is a mark of high professional competence. It indicates a soundness in depth, breadth and quality of accountancy knowledge.CPAs are widely regarded by employers and members. It provides members with an internationally recognised qualification as well as the opportunity to complete specialist training and continuing professional development (CPD). To use the CPA designation, a member must:•	complete a degree or a postgraduate award recognised by CPA Australia•	complete the CPA Program, including three years of professional experience in finance, accounting or business•	undertake CPD activities each year•	comply to a strict code of conduct set by CPA Australia.To offer public accounting services, CPAs must also complete CPA Australia's Public Practice Program, which involves distance learning and an Intensive, and must hold a Public Practice Certificate in accordance with the CPA Australia's by-laws.Join the conversation https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/join-the-conversationPlease visit our website for full terms and conditions http://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/utilities/terms and http://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/utilities/privacy privacy statementPlease contact us at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/contact-us

Name: Australian Universities Quality Agency
Location: Level 10, 123 Lonsdale St, Melbourne, Victoria 3000, AU
Overview:
The Australian Universities Quality Agency (AUQA) is an independent, not-for-profit national agency that promotes, audits, and reports on quality assurance in Australian higher education. 

It operates independently of governments and the higher education sector under the direction of a Board of Directors. AUQA is owned by and receives core, operational funding from the Commonwealth, State and Territory Ministers for higher education.  

AUQA is the principal national quality assurance agency in higher education with the responsibility of providing public assurance of the quality of Australia’s universities and other institutions of higher education, and assisting in enhancing the academic quality of these institutions. 


AUQA’s Objectives 

AUQA conducts quality audits of higher education institutions and accreditation authorities, reporting on performance and outcomes, assisting in quality enhancement, advising on quality assurance; and liaising internationally with quality agencies in other jurisdictions, for the benefit of Australian higher education.

Name: Australian Teachers Of Media QLD (ATOM QLD)
Location: PO Box 2040, Kelvin Grove, Queensland 4059, AU
Overview:
ATOM QLD Inc advocates for Media education in Queensland by providing professional development opportunities for teachers; advising education authorities on policy and curriculum development; and providing students with opportunities to engage critically with the media.

Members of ATOM QLD have been involved in every major development in media education in Queensland. These include the several versions of the Senior Film and Television syllabus, the publication of Education Queensland's Media Curriculum Guide in 1994 and the development of the Queensland Studies Authority's Media strand of the Years 1 to 10 Arts Syllabus. Currently members are involved with both the QCAA and C2C team in implementation of the National Curriculum and the future of senior testing.

Name: Space Design Competitions Australia
Location: PO Box 12553 George St, Brisbane City, QLD 4003, AU
Overview:
Space Design Competitions Australia are the premier provider of industry-simulation events for high-school students in Australia.
Our competitions aim to provide interactive, high-tempo, and dynamic environments for students to further their Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) skills.
Since 2006, we have partnered with a number of organisations across Australia to nourish and prepare the next generation of innovative young minds.
We run and support the following programmes:
1. Junior Space Design Competition (JDSC) - aimed at grades 5-8, this event aims to encourage middle school students into STEM skills via creating promotional material for space endeavours.
2. Australian Space Design Competition (ASDC) - aimed at grades 9-12, this event sees students form fictional aeronautical companies and engage in designing a futuristic space settlement. A Qualifying event runs across the Australian school year, with finalists participating in our Finals event each January, just prior to school resuming.
3. International Space Settlement Design Competition (ISSDC) Touring Team - the ASDC Champions travel to the ISSDC Finals, held each year at the Kennedy Space Centre (Florida, USA) where they work with student finalists from across the globe.
Address_0: George St, Brisbane City QLD 4003, Australia

Name: Australian Association of French English Bilingual Schools - AAFEBS
Location: New South Wales Crescent, Barton, ACT 2600, AU
Overview:
The Australian Association of French English Bilingual Schools (AAFEBS) is a membership organization of Primary and Secondary French English bilingual schools in Australia, most of which are accredited by the French Ministry of National Education or recognised through a Label “France Education”. The curriculum taught in these schools is enriched by aspects of French and Australian culture and educational practice.
AAFEB’s member schools educate bilingual, bicultural students, whose academic excellence prepares them for global citizenship as well as entrance to the finest universities on the world’s stage.
The association is non-profit and non-political.
AAFEB’s membership comprises the school leaders of each school who will be Members.
There are currently 11 AAFEBS schools throughout Australia. The level of French immersion and the number of subjects taught in English or French vary by school and grade level.

Name: Youth Mission Team Australia
Overview: Youth Mission Team Australia (YMT) is a Catholic non-profit unincorporated association that seeks to embrace a Christian community lifestyle and to bear witness to the power and relevance of the Gospel to students in high schools through the witness of that lifestyle and by creating a space in which students can make a free choice to invite Christ into their life. Imagine a group of gifted young people in the current generation who pursue a call to serve young people who are lacking in self-belief, hope, and faith in a love that surpasses everything else. Imagine a community of people rallying around these selfless young people year after year, enabling them to reach 16,000 teenagers annually.Imagine high school students around the country walking into a reflection day defensive and despondent, only to walk away having made a commitment to open up to Christ. This has been the vision of Youth Mission Team Australia since 1986 and it has been fulfilled in reality since then each year.

Name: Pyramid Educational Consultants of Australia P/L
Overview:
Pyramid is the exclusive home of the Picture Exchange Communication System (PECS) and the Pyramid Approach to Education.

Pyramid Educational Consultants is a worldwide group of companies that offers a wide range of training opportunities, consultation services and products for families and educators of individuals with autism and related disabilities. Pyramid is a consortium of highly trained professionals in the fields of developmental disabilities and communication impairment, dedicated to providing the highest quality education and care. 

Pyramid Educational Consultants of Australia offers training, consultation and products that focus on teaching functional communication and designing effective educational environments. We present a unique blend of broad-spectrum applied behaviour analysis and the development of functional communication skills, emphasising the individual needs of each person. 

The mission of Pyramid Educational Consultants is to provide exceptional behaviour analytic and communication consultation and training to support professionals, families, and caretakers in teaching and caring for individuals with learning difficulties. Functional and practical interventions using the full spectrum of applied behaviour analysis are used to teach individuals how to communicate, function independently, and be successful in their schools, homes, places of employment, and the community.

Name: Omani Students Society in Western Australia
Overview: Established in 2003, The Omani Students Society in Western Australia (OSSWA) is a non-profit organisation and is the premier representative body of all Omani students at Curtin University of Technology, Murdoch University, the University of Western Australia, Edith Cowan University, Central Institute of Technology and Canning Collage. Name: Real Time Learning Australia
Overview: Real Time Learning’s (RTL’s) Purpose is to support schools in expanding their capacity to deliver stimulating, enriching, and future-focused STEM learning experiences by establishing significant partnerships with industry and the tertiary sector. The driving Passion is to facilitate authentic learning, initially with students in years 5-8, by engaging their curiosity, expanding their creativity and developing their thinking and collaborative skills through innovative pathwaysReal Time Learning is a Social Purpose Organisation that is Non for Profit. Real Time Learning empowers young Australians to best understand through their engagement with STEM and Entrepreneurship how they can make a difference in a modern and constantly changing society.Real Time Learning addresses the shortage of expertise and opportunities to partner students with Real World Learning applications to STEM and Entrepreneurship. Engineers and Entrepreneurs are a rare find in the current education ecosystem. Real Time Learning provides schools and communities with an opportunity to outsource STEM and Entrepreneurship expertise. RTL provides students with opportunities to work alongside Industry Professionals such as engineers to partner their learning through making, creating and building Real World Solutions.  RTL bridges the gap between “Theory and Practice”. Students engage in outcomes that make a difference in our communities and industries. This authenticity is achieved through a myriad of large, medium and local business partnerships with Schools and Communities.

Name: New Era Institute Australia

Overview: New Era Institute, a Registered Training Organisation (RTO Code 41543, CRICOS Code 03509B) is located in the heart of Burwood, the Inner West of Sydney. Name: Fit Learning Australia
Overview: Fit Learning is an affiliate Fit Learning™ of America (see www.fitlearners.com).  The Fit Learning Method™ isolates core reading, comprehension, maths, writing, and thinking skills and trains them to fluency.  Fluency is rapid processing speed and a measure of true mastery or proficiency. Moving your child to fluency in these critical targets results in improved memory, heightened confidence, increased resistance to distractions and fatigue, and the ability to quickly and effortlessly learn new things. Such gains are essential regardless of the type of learner: gifted and talented, average, struggling, or learning challenged.Clinical Director, Mandy Mason BCBA implements the Fit Learning Method™ in Western Australia under the supervision of Dr. Kimberly Berens Phd. BCBA-D LBA who holds a doctoral degree in psychology with a specialisation in learning science, and has been developing the Fit Learning Method™ for over 10 years. Dr Berens oversees the learning of each learner in the Fit Learning program.The Fit Learning Method™ is a unique combination of Applied Behaviour Analysis, Precision Teaching, Direct Instruction, Curriculum-Based Measurement and Relational Frame Theory.  Fit Learning is the only program in Australia that combines all of these highly tested and researched methods into one comprehensive, instructional approach. The result is a profoundly transformative process that consistently produces 1 to 2 years growth in 40-50 hours of instruction.

Name: Australian School of Celtic Learning
Overview: Founded in December 2017 by Dr Pamela O’Neill, the Australian School of Celtic Learning is a community-oriented educational venture.  Our vision is for a world where everyone has affordable and accessible opportunities to learn about the Celtic cultures.  We present the latest and best research in the field of Celtic learning to all of our students, whether their interest is genealogical, spiritual, historical or linguistic.Our programmes are arranged in four terms each year, each beginning on one of the Celtic festivals of Imbolc, Bealtaine, Lughnasadh and Samhain.  We offer study days, evening courses, residential immersion schools and overseas study tours.  Topics for our programmes range widely over topics of Celtic interest, with a particular focus on the early medieval period, and on medieval and modern Celtic languages.

Overview: The focus of illuminate Education Australia is activate young people to be conﬁdent, creative and capable people to reach their full potential, and do this through delivering authentic entrepreneurial education programs where problems in the community are solved by students. All of our programs are focused around developing a core set of skills that help students be prepared for the changing world, which we have grouped as;- Communication (Speaking, Writing & Presentation Skills)- Understanding (Critical Thinking, Inquiry, Digital & Financial Literacy)- Solving Problems (Creativity, Problem Solving & Reﬂection)- Working Smart (Collaboration, Organisation & Perseverance)Every program we deliver is focused on providing authentic experiences to develop and explore this skills, as well as providing young people an opportunity to showcase their capacity to their peers, the school community, family and the wider community. Name: Cann10 Australia
Overview: Cann10 Australia is the country's first medicinal cannabis education company. By bringing together global and local leaders in medicinal cannabis science, clinical practice and industry, Cann10 Australia will continue to support medicinal cannabis through world-class education programs.The Cann10 Medicinal Cannabis Leadership Program will run in Melbourne from August 2017, in collaboration with DeakinCo., the commercial arm of Deakin University.The program will accelerate Australia’s medicinal cannabis industry by giving participants access to experts in fields of international and domestic law; chemistry and pharmacology; industry and commerce; agricultural science; clinical practice and more.The program will bring together medicinal cannabis science and industry leaders from Australia, America, Europe and Israel. 40 participants will take part in the program spanning 8 weeks of workshops, lectures and webinars.  The Program is ideal for doctors, nurses, pharmacists and scientists, as well as agricultural, biomedical and technological entrepreneurs. Participants will go on to start new ventures, research programs and businesses, expand their networks, and be ambassadors for the medicinal cannabis industry in Australia and around the world.

Name: Australian College of Professional Styling
Location: 607 Eastpoint Tower, 180 Ocean Road, Edgecliff, NSW 2027, AU
Overview:
Welcome to the Australian College of Professional Styling. With almost a decade of producing successful graduates, our College is an industry leader in producing professional stylists who can take on any assignment.
 
The Australian College of Professional Styling was established in 2009. Our directors have more than 30 years’ experience in the field of distance learning, and have trained students in more than 80 countries and territories.
 
The Australian College of Professional Styling offers The Professional Photo, Film, TV & Personal Stylist’s Course. The course has been designed to provide students with the professional skills required to succeed as a professional stylist. The course offers students a unique opportunity to develop a full or part-time career as a freelance fashion stylist or to seek full-time work in all the industry areas where stylists are needed right now.

Our course has been created to suit the needs of our students. As part of our course, students can work at their own pace, with no assignment deadlines and with a 24 month timeframe to complete all coursework in. With no face-to-face classes, students can work from the comfort of their own home or anywhere in the world, and at the times that best suit them. We also offer flexible payment plans so students can start their styling career with peace of mind. 

Students work directly with an industry professional who is currently working as a fashion stylist, and has a proven record of success. They will teach our students all they need to know to start building their styling career.

Our friendly student services coordinators are always ready to answer any questions students may have about our course, and continue their support to our graduates.

Overview: Campion College is Australia's first liberal arts college, fully accredited to offer bachelor and diploma studies in history, literature, philosophy, theology and classical languages. Our courses emphasise the ability to think critically and argue rationally, both in writing and in speech, as well as the development of the creative, analytical and research skills that are important in any career. Our graduates successfully transition into a number of fields including teaching, journalism, law, medicine, business, politics and academia. Name: Kodály Australia
Overview:
The Kodály Music Education Institute of Australia Inc is an organisation of people committed to music for everyone. We are united in the philosophy developed by Hungarian composer, Zoltan Kodály. Kodály stated that music education is the right of every child. He established that a sequential, cumulative and developmental program, based on an aural-vocal approach, is the most inclusive and effective way to develop musical literacy for people of all age groups. 

The Kodály Music Education Institute of Australia was founded by Deanna Hoermann in 1973. Now, with approximately 800 members in Australia, the Institute consists of State branches in the ACT, NSW, QLD, SA, VIC, and WA, with chapters in Armidale, Mackay and Townsville, along with the do-re-mi organisation which provides classes for young children. We also have some members in South East Asia.

The Kodály Music Education Institute of Australia is an affiliated member of the International Kodály Society.

The Australian Kodály Certificate is offered by the Institute in the fields of early childhood, primary, secondary and string teaching. The Australian Kodály Certificate is accepted for credit towards post-graduate study at several universities in Australia as well as at the Liszt Academy in Hungary.

The Australian Economics and Business Studies Competitions were founded in 1991. Students’ lives are enriched by the running of these high quality, challenging and meaningful competitions.

•	Provide an opportunity for students to demonstrate their skills by participating in a national competition 
•	Encourage awareness of current economics, business and political environment

The Competitions take place in May each year and are conducted for all registered high schools across Australia.

Name: Australian Universities Quality Agency (AUQA)
Overview: The Australian Universities Quality Agency (AUQA) was an independent, not-for-profit national agency that promoted, audited, and reported on quality assurance in Australian higher education. The Agency was liquidated in 2011.AUQA operated independently of governments and the higher education sector under the direction of a Board of Directors. AUQA was owned by and received core, operational funding from the Commonwealth, State and Territory Ministers for higher education.The Agency was the principal national quality assurance agency in higher education with the responsibility of providing public assurance of the quality of Australia’s universities and other institutions of higher education, and assisted in enhancing the academic quality of these institutions.AUQA conducted quality audits of higher education institutions and accreditation authorities, reported on performance and outcomes, assisted in quality enhancement, advised on quality assurance, and liaised internationally with quality agencies in other jurisdictions, for the benefit of Australian higher education.

Name: The Australian Consortium for '​In-Country'​ Indonesian Studies
Overview: The Australian Consortium for ‘In-Country’ Indonesian Studies (ACICIS – pronounced Ah-chee-chis, as an Indonesian would say it) is an innovative, non-profit, national educational consortium that was established in 1994 to overcome the substantial academic, bureaucratic, and immigration impediments that had prevented Australian students from undertaking credited semester study at Indonesian universities. Today ACICIS runs the Study Indonesia Program (SIP) which consists of a variety of study options in Indonesia and is also open to non-Australians and private individuals. ACICIS has offices in Indonesia, namely in the cities of Yogyakarta and Jakarta. It provides students with the best possible educational experience in Indonesia, in a safe, secure and supportive environment. ACICIS’ Indonesia-based staff provide academic and pastoral advice to students, an orientation program for new students prior to each program, assistance liaising with Indonesian authorities and universities, and oversee all aspects of in-country operations, including security and risk assessment.Programs include: Flexible Language Immersion,  Gadjah Mada University, YogyakartaWest Java Field Study Program, Parahyangan University, BandungEast Java Field Study Program, Muhammadiyah University, MalangIslamic Business, Law & Society, Islamic University of Indonesia, YogyakartaInternational Relations Program, Parahyangan University, BandungDevelopment Studies Immersion English Gadjah Mada University YogyakartaLanguage Teacher Immersion Indonesian Sanata Dharma University YogyakartaBusiness Professional Practicum., Atma Jaya University, JakartaDevelopment Studies Professional Practicum, Atma Jaya University, JakartaJournalism Professional Practicum, Atma Jaya University, JakartaLaw Professional Practicum, Atma Jaya University, Jakarta (NEW)Indonesian Language Short Course, Satya Wacana Christian University, Salatiga (NEW)

Name: Academy of Design Australia
Overview: LCI Melbourne is a design school in the global LCI Education Network. Our students have access to 23 campuses around the world and are inspired to design their own pathway to a creative future.Our Bachelor of Design Arts offers majors and sub-majors in a choice of: Communication Design (Creative Advertising), Fashion & Costume Design, Filmmaking & Photography, Graphic & Digital Design, Interior Design, and Visual Arts. The same year OTTE accredited the Bachelor of Design Arts, which was developed in association with the Australian Academy of the Arts.In 2015, the Academy of Design Australia became the 22nd campus in the LCI Education network allowing the students and staff to become part of a 12,000 strong creative network around the globe.

Name: WomenCAN Australia
Overview: WomenCAN Australia is dedicated to assisting women and girls to attain financial independence and autonomy through education, employment and the encouragement that comes from a shared lived experience.We do this with our social enterprise – WomenCAN Australia and our charity, The Placement Circle.There has been a rapidly emerging prevalence of older, poor, single females who find themselves without a permanent safe place to live and with limited or unreliable income. Our program supports a transition through education and employment for all women and girls so that they can achieve the financial and emotional strength to carry them through to a dignified old age.One well-documented circuit-breaker of poverty and attendant homelessness is reliable employment.  To be employed requires a skill set. We know that by building a business or being employed by another, the following benefits are realised:Generation of a reliable income stream;Restoration of confidence and self-esteem;Creation of and access to a supportive network of women with a shared lived experience.Through our membership model, we foster peer support from the lived experience of each other. When women feel that they belong and are valued, they can achieve anything. The encouragement and enthusiasm that comes from the story of others who have triumphed over adversity is contagious. We are about women supporting other women to improve their lives so they can make choices that empower them and determine their own destiny.Through our membership model, we foster peer support from the lived experience of each other. When women feel that they belong and are valued, they can achieve anything. The encouragement and enthusiasm that comes from the story of others who have triumphed over adversity is contagious. Overview:
Training Services Australia is one of WA’s oldest and most experienced training providers.  We have been delivering nationally recognised training for over 20 years and our philosophy in relation to training is as follows:

We believe that good employers provide training to employees to address long term needs.  As a result of this, everything we do ensures that the people we train are truly competent and workplace ready.  We achieve this by:


Working with clients to ensure the training is appropriate to the job.

Engaging and developing trainers that share our beliefs

Delivering training over realistic timeframes

Delivering qualifications over a series of workshops.  This ensures participants can consolidate their learning by applying it in the workplace before undertaking the next cluster.
 
Developing rigorous assessments to ensure participants demonstrate competence in a real workplace in line with companies’ systems, policies and processes
 
Developing our own comprehensive training and assessment materials, as well as maintaining and improving, them in consultation with our trainers and clients.

Intentionally maintaining a narrow scope of courses, because despite having highly effective trainers that are capable of delivering other courses, we believe in improving and expanding our business in our core areas of expertise.

Name: VA Institute of Australia
Overview:
Without fail, every VA has a story to tell about their journey from their employee role to becoming a VA, and it always includes a ‘catalyst’ for them to make the move from an employee to their own virtual business. 
 
For some people, the catalyst was because they have young kids and want to be there for them; or others might be fed up with commuting hours each day; or perhaps they’ve been made redundant and just don’t feel like going back to a full-time work; and some people live remotely and find job roles are hard to come by.
 
We should rejoice in these stories because they’re the very fabric of our diverse and wonderful industry.  We come from all walks of life, and we bring our own unique skills and talents with us.
 
The physical act of making the move is also different and unique for everyone.  Some people start gradually by dipping their ‘toe’ in the water to get a feel for it, some plan their start extremely meticulously, whilst some throw themselves in at the deep end and either sink or swim (not recommended!).

Moving from your employee based role to your new self-employed Virtual business in a way that sets you up for success requires a lot of thought and forward planning. 

The VA Institute is your go-to resource for education and training, and hands-on, practical support to support you in this exciting stage of your career / business life.  Our Signature Programs are built on a bedrock of real industry experience, and from a standpoint of setting yourself up for excellence from the outset.

To find out more about how The VA Institute can work with you, visit www.vainstitute.com.au or contact ingrid@vainstitute.com.au

Name: Australian Islamic College of Sydney
Overview:
The Australian Islamic College of Sydney values providing students with the opportunities to enable them to reach their highest possible level of academic, social and cultural attainment so that they become well-educated, responsible and religious citizens capable of contributing positively to the development and betterment of their own community, the nation and the world as a whole.

The College values:
a) Creation of an educational environment that is conducive to the development of students’
understanding of the central truths of the Islamic faith, the moral values and man’s relation to God
and fellow man;
b) Development of a harmonious and stimulating community atmosphere in which staff are mutually supportive and assist the students to develop self-appreciation, social awareness, reverence of life, integrity and responsibility
c) Encouraging each student to develop the highest possible level of academic social and cultural attainment he or she is capable of, with excellence as a goal in all activities.
d) Creation of a teaching learning environment that brings about balanced development of the intellectual, emotional, physical, cultural and spiritual elements of each students’ life;
e) The development of responsible citizens with a willingness to serve both their Islamic community and the wider Australian society;
f) The provision of an educational environment that promotes the spirit of enquiry and the skill for life-long learning.
The entire teaching and learning processes at the College are geared towards translating these values into practice.

The vision of the College is to become an educational institution of choice in Australia renowned for its ability to guide and educate its students to become model citizens with high level of academic excellence and Islamic values, morals and ethics.

All activities of the College are based on the above philosophy, mission, values and vision.

Name: Teach For Australia

Overview: We exist to change lives. Australia has one of the least equitable education systems in the developed world.Teach For Australia is part of a global movement dedicated to breaking the cycle of disadvantage through teaching and leadership in education.Teach For Australia Associates don’t start out as teachers – in fact, they come from all academic backgrounds. As such, there is no “ideal” candidate profile.We attract outstanding graduates and professionals from all academic disciplines, who commit to teaching in an educationally disadvantaged school for at least two years. Teaching may or may not be something that you have previously considered. We look for well-rounded and passionate individuals, who have the qualities to create change, inside the classroom and beyond.For the duration of our award-winning Leadership Development Program, you will:-  Teach at one of our partner secondary schools with full salary and benefits.-  Earn a Master of Teaching (Secondary) degree on scholarship.- Have access to rigorous and ongoing coaching.After two intense, challenging and unbelievably rewarding years, you’ll have completed the program and become part of our Alumni movement, working to see systemic change from positions of influence across all sectors of society.To be eligible, you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident. You must also have completed a bachelor’s degree in a discipline other than education by the end of 2019.Apply now: http://www.teachforaustralia.org/join-tfa/ldp/apply/

Name: Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA)
Overview: The Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA) is the national regulator for Australia’s vocational education and training (VET) sector. Our vision is that students, employers and governments have full confidence in the quality of vocational education and training outcomes delivered by Australian registered training organisations. We seek to ensure the sector's quality is maintained by effectively regulating vocational education and training providers, accredited vocational education and training courses, and Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS) providers including those delivering English Language Intensive Courses to Overseas Students (ELICOS).At ASQA, we seek to employ dedicated people who can contribute to a professional, responsive and innovative regulator. We are also committed to building an inclusive workplace that encourages and values the diversity of our employees.Enquiries about regulatory matters should be directed to the ASQA Info Line on 1300 701 801 between 9.00 am and 7.00 pm Eastern Standard Time (EST), Monday to Friday (dial +61 3 8613 3910 from outside Australia), or email enquiries@asqa.gov.au. We strengthen organisations by delivering training which reflects practices and principles that have been developed in the manufacturing sector over the last 80 years, often referred to as Lean manufacturing, Lean production or just ‘Lean’.

Our core business strategy is to increase productivity through practical lean implementation and then ensure that these results are sustained. Our program can achieve results quickly by focusing on areas with high potential for improvement.

The College of Law is the career college for lawyers in Australia and New Zealand. We are unique in operating in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, Canberra, Adelaide and Auckland as well as providing onsite training in key regional centres. We have over 140 teaching and support staff in total and we are committed to development of the profession in both countries. 

For those practitioners interested in career and practice development, The College offers Master of Laws (Applied Law) programs with majors and subjects in Commercial Litigation, Commercial Transactions, Family Law, In-house Practice, Property Law and Wills & Estates. The postgraduate applied law programs focus on the practical delivery of legal services in order to improve client outcomes. They are conducted primarily online in order to meet the needs of busy practitioners.

For legal practitioners in NSW, we provide a large suite of Practitioner Education (CPD/MCLE) programs, both face-to-face and online, making it easy to meet MCLE requirements. Our programs range from one-hour quick updates to full day conferences. We also offer the Legal Practice Management Course for those lawyers seeking an unrestricted practising certificate in NSW.

To connect with fellow College of Law graduates, join The College of Law Alumni Group!

The main difference for our school is the industry relevance with our training programs We want our graduates to be able to step foot in a clinical environment and a traditional spa and know exactly how it works, what to do, and how to be a great therapist. Our courses focus on skin biology and skin science while still teaching the traditional elements. We also want our graduates to be aware of their pathways in this industry: do they want to be a beauty therapist? A skin or laser therapist? A clinic manager or owner? Or even an educator. And how do they get there? What training and experience do they need? We are all about giving our students a career path, rather than just a job.

Name: Australia Education Management Group (AEMG)
Overview:
In 1999, Australia Education Management Group (AEMG) registered and emerged in Victoria State of Australia Melbourne, whose purpose is to promote the Australian culture to spread and exchange in other countries and regions, and introduce the international contents to rich local culture in Australia. 

The business of AEMG spread all over Australia, Asia and America. 

In Australia, it set up characteristic services such as student service, cultural diffusion, Chinese language teaching. 
In Asia, we headquarter in China Beijing, and establish a unique international education management mode. In America, our primary business is to spread Chinese culture and the communication between Chinese students and American students.

In the development of these years, AEMG devoted to promoting the popularization and communication of multilateral education culture, and has helped many international activities to bring about. 

In order to commend our group’s great contributions in these fields, a number of government and non-governmental institutions including Australia Ministry of Education, Australian government, Chinese Embassy in Australia, China Ministry of Education, Hanban, etc praise the outstanding achievement made by our group in all kinds of public occasion in succession.

1999年，澳大利亚教育管理集团在澳大利亚维多利亚州墨尔本注册产生，其宗旨是促进澳大利亚文化在澳洲以外的其他国家与地区传播、交流，同时引入国际内容以丰富澳大利亚本土文化。澳大利亚教育管理集团业务遍布澳洲、亚洲、美洲。在澳洲，设立了以学生服务、文化传播、汉语言教学等的特色服务；在亚洲，我们以中国北京为总部，建立了独特的国际教育管理模式；在美洲，我们以传播中国文化、中美间学生交流为主要业务。集团在多年发展过程中，致力于推动多边教育文化的推广与交流，并促成了多项国际活动的开展。

集团在华业务始于2001年，最初以协助中澳高校建立合作项目为主要目的。经过十年的发展，集团已经形成一整套的合作办学机构、合作办学项目、校际国际合作的管理经验。从一个项目到数个项目，集团提供HCP中学项目、UFP预科项目、TAFE项目、PMP项目、JEP项目等数个可选择的合作方式。从一所到数十所合作高校，集团不断汲取优秀合作伙伴的优点，发挥自身的优势，并以其的卓越不断吸引着越来越多的合作伙伴。从一名到数百名教师，集团正以不断创新、不断进取的精神孕育着一批联合办学教育领域的中坚力量。从几名到上万名的学子，集团以优质的教育品质哺育着莘莘学子，为他们美好的明天做最完美的铺垫。集团已经从一个项目管理实践开拓的机构，发展成为教育管理这一新兴行业的引领者。

Name: National Indigenous Business Summer School Western Australia (NIBSSWA)
Overview: NIBSSWA is a joint initiative of Curtin University, Edith Cowan University, Murdoch University, The University of Notre Dame Australia and The University of Western Australia under the auspices of the Australian Business Deans Council. Katitjiny boya birrit/ Pathway to understanding business - is modelled on similar successful national indigenous business summers school offerings held on the east coast of Australia. The program aims to inspire and support Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander high school students who are interested in pursuing a career in business.Year 11 and 12 students from across the State will take part in a week-long academic residential program designed to help them understand how their study choices could positively influence their future, the options available in a business career, the prominent role of Aboriginal businesses and entrepreneurs in Western Australia, and the possibilities offered by higher education. The program is designed for students thinking of entering a business related career or becoming an entrepreneur.The Summer School aims to provide Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander students with an in-depth insight into business and university life, while focusing on team-building, motivation, meeting new people, Indigenous culture, confidence building and health and well-being.Eligible students are those who are completing Year 11 or 12 studies , have an interest and demonstrated ability in commerce and/or business, identify with their Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander culture and heritage and are prepared to challenge themselves academically and personally in a supportive environment.The program will introduce students to the world of business by immersing them in a week- long Summer School, with interaction with business academics and professionals of all disciplines, site visits to industry and corporate partners, cultural activities and interactions with the Aboriginal business community.

Name: Skilling Australia Foundation
Overview: Our VisionAn Australia where all young people have a pathway to a meaningful and rewarding career.Our MissionTo bridge the gap between unemployment and a meaningful career for disadvantaged young Australians.About UsWhen a young person finishes school in Australia, they’re work-ready, right? This is where the Skilling Australia Foundation comes to the fore with our passion for skills-based education.We work in innovative ways to support young Australians facing disadvantage to forge their own career pathways through training and meaningful employment. By teaming up with schools, industry, business, governments and the vocational educational and training sector, the Skilling Australia Foundation has helped more than 1,300 young people build the skills towards a meaningful career, setting them up for a career of their choice.How we do itWe take a multi-dimensional approach by offering:Free job-readiness programsTuition-fee relief grantsMerit based scholarships for high-achieving apprentices and traineesCollaboration with schools and industry with to equip students with the skills required for the workforce of the 21st centuryThe Foundation was set up in 2012 and commenced activities in 2013. Name: Road Safety Educators Australia
Location: p o box 1849, Geelong, Victoria 3220, AU
Overview:
Changing the paradigm, into driver education. Vision Zero is achievable!
Driver education delivered in a pedagogical framework, using coaching methodologies, matched to each clients learning style, in tailored environments referencing Road Safety Educators Australia 797unit competency based curriculum, delivered by Educators and measured against crash rates post training.
Significantly different than diving instructor test route practice. The Australian driver testing system is aimed at the lowest level for instructors and learners, drivers are expected to learn safety on their own whilst driving in a system that has significant risk. we do not accept this as a safe system under Vision Zero Initiative.
Drivers must be educated to self calibrate safe processes that can be applied at any specific integration between road users in an automated management system. we have captured every main driving situation and applied a safe manageable lowest risk management system into 44 modules (797 units of Competency), supported by Australia’s most advanced and effective driver training system. Educator, Supervisor, Learner. 
Changing The Paradigm.

Name: Improving Schools Australia Pty Ltd

Overview:
The ultimate goal of school improvement is to improve outcomes for students, including levels of achievement and wellbeing. However, each school faces challenges to find the most effective ways of engaging students, staff, parents/caregivers and the local community in review conversations, for gathering and using data to inform evidence-based judgements, and for prioritising and allocating resources towards
improving student learning. Schools which are demonstrating success in this area have: committed to creating a culture of continuing review and renewal with improved outcomes for students at the centre of those efforts; adopted cyclical review processes to enable demonstration, to their community and to
relevant government authorities, of the quality and effectiveness of their educational provision,and their commitment to ongoing improvement. The implementation of cyclical review processes must always be responsive to the different contexts of each school.

OUR MISSION

To assist all members of each (the) school and their local communities to create and sustain a culture
of continuing review, renewal and improvement so that each student can experience improvededucational outcomes, in particular those related to levels of achievement and wellbeing.

The Learning Club runs non-accredited learning sessions based in experiential learning methods and life experience.Our first learning sessions were for seniors using new technology.  The sessions are practical and learning based with participants leaving each session having firstly gained a foundation, then a building block in how to do something new - this principle runs through everything we stand for and deliver at TLC.Our model brings people together, opens communication, breaks down perceived barriers, stereotypes and fixed beliefs in the people's perception that they can't learn or aren't smart enough - we gradually turn these beliefs around. Name: Australian Mathematical Sciences Institute
Location: Building 161, c/- The University of Melbourne, Parkville, VIC 3010, AU
Overview:
AMSI is the collaborative enterprise of Australia’s mathematical sciences. It exists to give independence to our disciplines and provide infrastructure so that we can take initiatives on the national and international stage. These measures fall largely into three classes – research and higher education, school education and engagement with the industrial and commercial world. 

AMSI has built a record of achievement in these areas and is recognised by government and industry as a leading provider of services, activities and strategic initiatives. 

The common aim we share with our partners is the radical improvement of levels of mathematical capacity and facility in the Australian community. It is AMSI’s ability to pull together skills and experience at the highest levels across the spectrum of the mathematical sciences that underlies our impact. 

We acknowledge the considerable support of both the Victorian and Commonwealth governments in the establishment of AMSI and some of its programs and we invite potential partners to join us in invigorating Australia’s mathematical sciences in the 21st century.

Name: Academy of the Social Sciences in Australia
Overview: The Academy of the Social Sciences in Australia was established in 1971 to recognise and champion excellence in the social sciences and to provide evidence-based advice on a range of social policy issues.The Academy comprises of an elected Fellowship of almost 700 distinguished Australian social science researchers and professionals who work together to:Provide advice to governments on issues of national importance;Promote understanding and awareness of the social sciences; andCoordinate international cooperation and collaboration in the social sciences.The Academy is an independent, non-government organisation committed to equity, diversity and inclusion in the social sciences; particularly the involvement and recognition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.It is the one of the four learned academies in Australia. The four academies co-operate to provide interdisciplinary advice on important matters of public policy through the Australian Council of Learned Academies (ACOLA, formerly the National Academies Forum, formed in 1995).

Overview: Alcohol and Drug Awareness Australia (ADAA) - leaders in the provision of Australian workplace drug and alcohol training programs.Drugs or alcohol now factor in as many as one-in-ten workplace deaths, and one-in-four reportable workplace accidents. And, misuse of these substances is growing across Australian workplaces.It is a serious work health and safety issue that is not going “to simply go away”.ADAA is an agent-for-change in improving the health, safety and welfare of Australian workers and Australian workplaces by building awareness and prompting action on the misuse of drugs and alcohol, their negative effects on physiological and psychological well-being, and their contribution to workplace risk, death and injury as well as through fostering an open, supportive workplace culture where co-workers feel comfortable in reaching out for help without fear of retribution.Through education, self-reflection, awareness and action, our driven goal is that every worker, in every workplace, in every organisation, makes the right choices for their own health, safety and welfare, and for the health, safety and welfare of co-workers and the community.

Our purpose is to work with all stakeholders to achieve the objectives of the National Quality Framework: ● Ensure the safety, health and wellbeing of children attending education and care services ● Improve the educational and developmental outcomes for children attending education and care services ● Promote continuous improvement in the provision of quality education and care services ● Improve public knowledge, and access to information, about the quality of education and care services ● Establish a system of national integration and shared responsibility between participating jurisdictions and the Commonwealth in the administration of the national education and care services quality framework ● Reduce the regulatory and administrative burden for education and care services by enabling information to be shared between participating jurisdictions and the Commonwealth.

For general information about Kumon, visit http://au.kumonglobal.com. 

__________________

Kumon is the largest after-school learning programme and one of the most established franchise businesses in the world. There are currently more than 4.2 million students studying Kumon across 49 countries and regions and almost 50,000 students enrolled across 330 Kumon Centres in Australia and New Zealand.

Kumon’s unique method of learning helps children of all ages and abilities develop fundamental reading comprehension and calculation skills. The Kumon programmes enable students to study at a level where they build confidence from day one, developing discipline, time management skills and essential study habits. Over time, students are able to study advanced material confidently and independently, for success in school and everyday life. 

As a franchise business, we are seeking like-minded people to work as Kumon staff and Kumon franchisees, who believe in each and every child's potential. 

Kumon franchisees have the wonderful role of nurturing children to learn with confidence. They also have the opportunity to build a business that makes a meaningful impact on the local community and become part of a network of associates who are working towards developing 'life skills'​ in children around the world. 

Kumon staff members work within an international organisation as well as consult one-on-one with franchisees. We pride ourselves on our sense of community with support offices in major capital cities (Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Perth and Auckland). 

At Kumon we believe that close contact between franchisees and staff is essential in improving the quality of education for all children.

Name: Australian Curriculum Studies Association
Location: Deakin Professional Centre, Unit 5, 46 Geils Court, Deakin, ACT 2600, AU
Overview:
The Australian Curriculum Studies Association Incorporated (ACSA) was established in 1983 as a broadly based educational association supporting the professional interests of educators in curriculum work from all levels and sectors within and beyond Australia.

ACSA works to support educators so that all students have access to a meaningful, relevant and engaging curriculum. ACSA provides national advocacy and leadership in curriculum. It is committed to curriculum reform informed by the principles of social justice and equity and respect for the democratic rights of all.

ACSA achieves these goals through alliances and interaction with education groups and broader local and global community organisations. ACSA seeks to cooperate with teachers and schools, professional associations, governments and government agencies in order to pursue its goals. ACSA acts as an advocate for the profession in forums where education policy is shaped. It engages in research, innovation, policy development, critique and dissemination of curriculum ideas.

Through membership of the Australian Curriculum Studies Association you are a part of a group which:

Provides curriculum leadership across the nation
Engages in curriculum research
Encourages critical and reflective curriculum practice
Provides forums for the exchange of information on curriculum developments
Develops and publishes curriculum resources and materials
Conducts a biennial conference and biennial curriculum symposium

Overview:
Virtual Enterprise Australia is where education and business connect.  

We teach students about business in a practical way, by getting them to run their own company, inspired by business mentors.

Through our 15 year history of working with large and snall organisations across Australia and in our global network, we have identified that we can help business to: 

-	up-skill their staff
-	enhance their community engagement; and 
-	become an employer of choice; through offering student mentoring opportunities.

We create innovative tailor-made programs in partnership with organisations to help education and business. 

Through our history of working with hundreds of teachers and trainers across Australia, we have identified 3 key questions facing educators today:

-	How do you attract students to courses
-	How do you motivate disengaged students
-	How do you develop employability skills in students to achieve great emplloyment outcomes.

We believe that there should be no mediocrity in education.  And we are convinced that our engaging model is the most effective way to teach students about business.

Name: Formula Student® - Australia RTO 41124
Location: Mt Gravatt Tafe Campus, 1030 Cavendish Rd, Mt Gravatt East, Qld 4122, AU
Overview:
Formula Student is a training organisation whose philosophy is designed around the student, not the teacher.

With student-centric classes we are different from other training organisations whose philosphy revolves around teacher-centric programs. Our classes are based on learning while the others are based on teaching.

With this student-centric philosophy as the centrepiece of learning at Formula Student, we believe the student needs to have ownership in their progress and a clear understanding of not just how to do a task but why. On top of this, the learning needs to be relevant and/or useful. I know I don't like making token items that mean nothing and end up in the bin at the end of the class so why would others be inspired by this out-dated and irrelevant method of learning.

We use motorsport as a base for our learning. Students develop a paradigm of what the end result is early in the course and from there we create a learning pathway for the student to follow to achieve the outcomes expected.

While we use motorsport as a base, the course ISN'T ABOUT motorsport. What it IS ABOUT is engineering pathways. It's about skills and knowledge development. It's about developing a familiarity with the engineering discourse, from the language used, to the processes and methods. It's about students building an understanding of jobcards and two way communication. It's about building an understanding of quality assurance and how this is achieved. It's about learning through project work. It's about being a member of a team. It's about communicating with others in an informative and accurate way. And they do this by building a full size race car from scratch!!!....

It's really about the students, and their future employers. This page is called "about us", although it should be called "ABOUT THEM" !!
Address_0: Mt Gravatt Tafe Campus, Mt Gravatt East, Qld, 4122, AU

Name: Australian Centre for NanoMedicine
Overview:
The Australian Centre for NanoMedicine commenced at the University of New South Wales (UNSW) in 2011. Our unique research centre incorporates researchers from UNSW’s faculties of Engineering, Medicine and Science. The Centre's mission remains to provide solutions to clinical challenges in medicine through world leading interdisciplinary researchers in diagnostics and therapeutic delivery.

Team ACN continues to work on diseases including neuroblastoma, lung, blood and pancreatic cancers, while diabetes, asthma and uveitis are part of our non-cancer portfolio. Our skills in drug delivery, imaging agents and diagnostic devices are producing world leading outcomes reflected in our strong publication record.

ACN has established the International NanoMedicine Conference series, which will be in its 8th year in 2017. This event is regarded as the most significant nanomedicine meeting in the Southern Hemisphere, taking place annually at our local beach, Coogee Beach Sydney, early July. We hope you will join us for Great Science in a Great Location.

Name: Australian Institute Of Tecnical Chefs
Overview: WHAT IS A CHARTED TCHEF? The common public belief is that anyone who cooks food as a job is a chef. However a genuine professional chef is much more than wearing a crisp white coat,  and only preparing food. Furthermore, unfortunately the title Chef, Professional Chef, Certified Chef, Master Chef, Executive Chef, Chef de cuisine, and other job descriptions have different ambiguous meanings that  depend upon various perceptions.  The TechnicalChef logo is the Australian Commercial Cookery Industry validation  that shows the title holder is also an inducted professional commercial chef who has met the Institutes professional industrial standards in commercial cookery training and commercial kitchen experience; and aware of their ethical obligations in practice. Primarily, a registered “TechnicalChef” identifies a leading professional in the Australian Commercial cookery.

VHS will provide secondary-level students with an exciting, alternative educational option that embraces a co-creative approach to teaching and supports students to be independent and manage their own learning.As the Village primary schools at Koonwarra and Phillip Island evolved it became clear that there was a distinct need for a Village High School. A place where students could continue to build on the self-management and decision-making skills they have developed in primary school. Village School students have high expectations about the educational experience they will receive, and we feel strongly about the importance of providing an ongoing pathway for our primary school students in which these expectations can be met.At VHS, we focus on creating educational pathways that encourage individuals to develop their ‘spark’ for learning. Our approach to education is founded on the idea that young people, with a growth mindset and practical support, are highly capable of setting and achieving their goals.

Overview:
National Apprentice Employment Network (NAEN) (formerly Group Training Australia) is the national association representing a network of around 100 group training organisations (GTOs) located throughout metropolitan, regional and remote areas of Australia. 

Collectively the national network of group training organisations employs around 25,000 apprentices and trainees and over 100,000 businesses have used a group training organisation to manage the employment of their apprentices and trainees. 

NAEN provides advocacy and professional development services for the GTO national network, working closely with the state group training associations. NAEN promotes the benefits of the group training model of apprentice and trainee employment and highlights the contribution of the group training network to skills development.

Name: Graduate Management Association of Australia (GMAA)
Overview: The Graduate Management Association of Australia, or GMAA, is a nationally recognised business association, with a diverse range of members residing across Australia, as well as overseas. Our mission is to promote the standing and enhance the value of MBA, DBA and other postgraduate management qualifications.We have members whom have obtained an MBA, DBA and other postgraduate management qualifications from approved Australian and international programs residing in all states of Australia and overseas. For individuals looking to begin an MBA or any other business management qualification at an Australian university we provide an annual, internally designed, comprehensive 5 star ranking of Australian University MBA courses. Through membership we also offer exclusive networking opportunities with business professionals.For postgraduate students of a business degree, and business professionals, we offer the opportunity to increase your business networking contacts tenfold. This is done by providing a targeted platform for social networking (see "networking opportunities"​ above) between our different member groups, including a regular schedule of new events. We have recognised that the need to maintain and enhance the MBA qualification is necessary if future students and employers are to continue valuing it.We offer membership to business university postgraduates and undergraduates (MBA, DBA etc), corporate business association members (senior managers, business and government specialists, business academics), as well as those completing other business management qualifications available in Australia.  A clear factor of a successful business association is great networking. At GMAA we recognised this key component, and thus established learning channels through which others could gain the experience they desired.

Name: Un salto a Australia
Overview: Un Salto a Australia es una agencia que asesora y gestiona visados de estudiante en Australia para personas de diferentes países hispanohablantes. Ayudamos a todo el que sueña con vivir y trabajar en Australia a crear su experiencia desde cero y lo acompañamos durante el proceso de adaptación. Aunque en la práctica somos mucho más que una simple agencia: somos la familia que recibe al estudiante al otro lado del mundo. Nuestra empresa nace en 2015 del blog personal de su fundadora, Nathalie Arco, a través del cual ayudaba y aconsejaba a otras personas que, como ella, soñaban con dar su salto a Australia. Un año más tarde, ya tenía empleados repartidos por las distintas ciudades del país y a día de hoy hemos gestionado más de 400 visados ayudando a más de 400 personas a dar el salto.  Nuestro equipo está formado por jóvenes profesionales que en su día pasaron por el mismo proceso por el que pasan los estudiantes con los que trabajamos, y no tenemos oficinas físicas porque para nosotros la productividad está directamente relacionada con la libertad de trabajar desde dónde quieras y cuándo quieras. Al mismo tiempo contamos con miembros del equipo en cada ciudad de Australia que se encargan de recibir y acompañar a los estudiantes en su periodo de adaptación de forma presencial, así como en distintas partes de España. Esto hace que ‘burlemos’ la diferencia horaria y siempre haya alguien conectado las 24 horas del día.  Entre los servicios que ofrecemos, destacan: - Orientación personalizada - Creación de un plan de estudios adaptado- Gestión de matrícula en la escuela y del curso elegido- Contratación del seguro médico obligatorio (OSHC)- Tramitación del visado de estudiante- Kit de Bienvenida (incluye tarjeta SIM con el primer mes de saldo)- Reservas de alojamiento y transporte a la llegada- Soporte presencial en la ciudad elegida- Asesoramiento personalizado para asegurar la integración- Organización de eventos y viajes- Renovación de visado
